page.title: 02Long Lawford Village
page.content: To the north of the area is the village of Long Lawford.referred to in the Domesday Book as Lelleford (The ford by the elders).The village is reputed to be the largest village in the country for it has grown in recent years due to the development of a large amount of council housing and the original identity of the village has almost disappeared.Some of the older housing still remains in Main Street and Cross Street,the two original streets in the village. In truth, the village is now nothing more than a suburb of the nearby town of Rugby which provides most of the amenities and services for the village.The services that do exist in the village are few and the surrounding countryside which forms the largest part of the block is dominated by agricultural use.
